okama.frontier package¶

Submodules¶

okama.frontier.multi_period module¶

class okama.frontier.multi_period.EfficientFrontierReb(symbols=None, *, first_date=None, last_date=None, ccy='USD', inflation=True, reb_period='year', n_points=20, verbose=False, tickers=True)¶

Bases: okama.assets.AssetList

Efficient Frontier (EF) for rebalanced portfolios. Rebalancing periods could be: ‘year’ - one Year (default) ‘none’ - not rebalanced portfolios Asset labels are set with ‘tickers’: True - for tickers False - for full asset names TODO: Add bounds

property ef_points¶

Return a DataFrame of points for Efficient Frontier when the Objective Function is the risk (std) for rebalanced portfolio.

Each point has: - Weights (float) - CAGR (float) - Risk (float) … and the weights for each asset.

get_ef_points()¶

Get all the points for the Efficient Frontier running optimizer.

If verbose=True calculates elapsed time for each point and the total elapsed time.

get_monte_carlo(n=100)¶

Generate N random risk / cagr point for rebalanced portfolios. Risk and cagr are calculated for a set of random weights.

property global_max_return_portfolio¶

Returns the weights and risk / CAGR of the maximum return portfolio point.

property gmv_annual_values¶

Returns the annual risk (std) and CAGR of the Global Minimum Volatility portfolio.

property gmv_annual_weights¶

Returns the weights of the Global Minimum Volatility portfolio with annualized values of risk / return

property gmv_monthly_weights¶

Returns the weights of the Global Minimum Volatility portfolio with monthly values of risk / return

property max_annual_risk_asset¶

Find an asset with max annual risk.

property max_cagr_asset¶

Find an asset with max CAGR.

property max_cagr_asset_right_to_max_cagr¶

The asset with max CAGR lieing to the right of the global max CAGR point (risk should be more than self.max_return[‘Risk’]). Global max return point should not be an asset.

maximize_risk(target_return)¶

Returns the optimal weights and risk / cagr values for a max risk at the target cagr.

minimize_risk(target_return)¶

Returns the optimal weights and risk / cagr values for a min risk at the target cagr.

property n_points¶
property reb_period¶

Rebalancing period for multi-period Efficient Frontier.

Rebalancing periods could be: ‘year’ - one Year (default) ‘none’ - not rebalanced portfolios

Returns
str
property target_cagr_range_left¶

Full range of cagr values (from min to max).

property target_cagr_range_right¶

Range of cagr values from the Global CAGR max to the max asset cagr to the right of the max CAGR point (if exists).

property target_risk_range¶

Range of annual risk values (from min risk to max risk).

property tickers¶

Return a list of tickers (symbols without a namespace) used to set the AssetList.

tickers are similar to symbols but do not have namespace information:

  • SPY is a ticker

  • SPY.US is a symbol

Returns
list of str

List of tickers included in the Asset List.

property verbose¶

okama.frontier.single_period module¶

class okama.frontier.single_period.EfficientFrontier(symbols=None, *, first_date=None, last_date=None, ccy='USD', bounds=None, inflation=True, full_frontier=True, n_points=20, tickers=True)¶

Bases: okama.assets.AssetList

Efficient Frontier (EF) with classic MVA implementation. n - is a number of points in the EF. full_frontier = False - shows only the points with the return above GMV tickers = True - labels of data in DataFrame are tickers (asset long names if False)

property bounds¶
property ef_points¶

DataFrame of weights and risk/return values for the Efficient Frontier. The columns of the DataFrame: - weights - mean return - CAGR - risk (std) All the values are annualized.

get_monte_carlo(n=100, kind='mean')¶

Generate N random risk / cagr point for portfolios. Risk and cagr are calculated for a set of random weights.

property gmv_annualized¶

Returns the annualized risk and return of the Global Minimum Volatility portfolio

property gmv_monthly¶

Returns the monthly risk and return of the Global Minimum Volatility portfolio

property gmv_weights¶

Returns the weights of the Global Minimum Volatility portfolio

property mean_return_range¶

Returns the range of mean monthly returns (from the min to max).

minimize_risk(target_return, monthly_return=False, tolerance=1e-08)¶

Finds minimal risk given the target return. Returns a “point” with monthly values: - weights - mean return - CAGR - risk (std) Target return is a monthly or annual value: monthly_return = False / True tolerance - sets the accuracy for the solver

optimize_return(option='max')¶

Finds global max or min for the rate of return. Returns monthly values for the risk, mean return and the weights. ‘max’ - search for global maximum ‘min’ - search for global minimum
